Web Security

How would you advise a potential client to secure his/her website from web security attacks? Note: the word count for your answer should not be greater than 250 words

The most important advice to give a client is never to trust incoming data, and to always sanitize incoming data. For example, HTTP headers and cookies and user uploaded files. They should adopt a cybersecurity framework. Their web server should use HTTPS and HSTS to encrypt data sent between clients and servers. They should also keep up to date on the current OWASP list of most common vulnerabilities. In cases where valuable information such as credit cards and phone numbers must be stored, only the last few digits should be visible so that only the user can recognize it. Encourage the use of two factor authentication through physical hardware such as a phone. They should also perform regular security exercises such as scans, mock attacks, and bounty programs.
